# Vercel Doctor

Reduce your Vercel bill by optimizing function duration, bundle size, and platform usage for Next.js projects. Scans for cost-related issues and outputs a 0â€“100 score with actionable diagnostics.

## Usage

Run this at your project root:

```bash
npx -y vercel-doctor@latest .
```

Use `--verbose` to see affected files and line numbers:

```bash
npx -y vercel-doctor@latest . --verbose
```

Use `--diff` to scan only changed files (branch changes or uncommitted changes):

```bash
npx -y vercel-doctor@latest . --verbose --diff
```

Use `--score` to output only the numeric score:

```bash
npx -y vercel-doctor@latest . --score
```

Use `-y` to skip prompts (required for non-interactive environments like CI or coding agents):

```bash
npx -y vercel-doctor@latest . -y
```

## Options

```
Usage: vercel-doctor [directory] [options]

Options:
  -v, --version     display the version number
  --no-lint         skip linting
  --no-dead-code    skip dead code detection
  --verbose         show file details per rule
  --score           output only the score
  -y, --yes         skip prompts, scan all workspace projects
  --project <name>  select workspace project (comma-separated for multiple)
  --diff [base]     scan only files changed vs base branch or uncommitted changes
  -h, --help        display help for command
```
